data.title: Quality restaurant fills a niche.
data.text: The Greater Lafayette area is filled with so-so restaurants and there is a need for higher quality establishments.  East End Grill is definitely a step up from most of the restaurants.  My family has eaten here several times and we have tried most of the menu items.  Everything we have had is good and would be great if it wasn't so salty.  This is particularly noticeable in the shrimp and grits and also their asparagus. This seems to be the opinion of many of my friends as well.  The service is top notch and now that soundproofing has been added to the ceiling, it has a wonderful ambiance. Pricing is good as well.  The crab cake salad is one of my favorites and don't miss the flourless chocolate cake.

data.title: So much better!
data.text: The food was always good but the acoustics made conversation unbearable until now!  AWESOME difference.  My husband and I could sit and talk even in a crowded restaurant.  The acoustics have been re-vamped and it's amazing.  We will be back again.  I had the crab cake salad and it was awesome.  Thanks for fixing this!

data.title: There's a new restaurant in town!!!
data.text: We've eaten here for lunch and dinner.  Both meals were outstanding.  The prices are reasonable for high end fare, and the ambience very nice... a recently restored building displaying beautiful brick masonry and local art work.  The wait staff are well trained and very pleasant.  It's my new favorite!!

data.title: Top Notch Experince
data.text: Not only does this restaurant have a great menu it has a wonderful ambiance.  The restored building is beautiful, with wonderful art and a warm and inviting place to have an excellent meal with friends and family.  There is also a great selection of cocktails, craft beers and wine.  Whether it is a large family get together or an intimate dinner for two it is a delightful place to eat.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
Very good food.  Great decor.   Overall has the atmosphere of a high end eatery.  Reasonable prices, good portions.  

Must try = Trout and for dessert the flourless cake.

data.title: New and nice
data.text: We went to the East End Grill for lunch today. New restaurant and really well designed. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and our waitress appeared almost instantly. Our orders were brought to the table in a timely fashion and well presented. All of our meals were very good as was the service. I would highly recommend this restaurant and will patronize when I get back to the area.

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text: We visited East End Grill for the second time last night and it was amazing once again!  The restaurant is beautifully decorated.  The only negative is that it is very noisy which is something that would normally keep us from going back but my husband and I both agreed the food quality far out weighs the noise factor.  The owner mentioned that they are working on correcting that soon.  The food is fast but extremely fresh.  Last night my husband ordered the swordfish special and it was so delicious and moist. Wow! I've had the Lemon Thyme Chicken both times because it is the best chicken I've ever had.

data.title: Trendy atmosphere, interesting menu, but skip the greasy fries!
data.text:
This is one of the newest establishments in downtown Lafayette. I visited with my co-workers for lunch during the week. The decor is quite modern and very trendy. Patio seating is also available. There was no wait at noon for a party of 7 and the speed of service was decent. In terms of the quality of service, when the food was ready, two servers delivered 4 of our 7 orders and then we waited at least 4 minutes before they brought the remaining 3 orders (perhaps this was why my fries were so soggy!). 

The lunch menu is a bit limited (mostly sandwiches and salads) with only 2 entree choices, so I would recommend reviewing the menu before bringing picky eaters. A few people in my group raved about the pastrami, but I am generally not a fan of that type of meat. The shrimp and grits got rave reviews as well. I tried the Shaved Picnic Friend Chicken Club served on fresh herb bread from a local bakery. The sandwich name was a bit misleading as it contained sliced chicken breast that didn't seem to be fried. Not a fan of mayo so I asked for the garlic aioli on the side but I think it would have been a good compliment. I splurged on the "house cut fries" as a side dish to accompany the sandwich but was disappointed in how greasy they were.  It was clear that they were fresh and homemade, just way too soggy. Next time I would go with soup or salad instead. Not the best lunch I have ever had, but definitely willing to go back and try the dinner menu.

data.title: Another Downtown Lafayette Option
data.text:
We went to this new restaurant in downtown Lafayette after a movie night.  It was pretty busy but we were able to be seated without any problems.  AS we entered we came into a wide open space that looked like it was a redone industrial space with brick walls and sleek metal finishes.  We were seated in the bar area.  The surroundings were uninspiring and somewhat boring setting for dinner.  

We ordered a couple of drinks from the bar.  They were strong drinks.  We did not find the drinks exceptional in any way.  For dinner we ordered the East End Pastrami Cobb Salad and the 1/2 pound East End Burger.   We both desired the salad so we decided to share it and split the burger.  One thing that was excellent with this place was their willingness to accommodate our desire to split and share our entrees.  They actually split the salad and burger for us in the kitchen.  The unique salad was good as was the burger.

This was a place were service was accommodating and the food unique.  To be honest though for us it was uninspiring.  This is not a place likely to make it into our restaurant rotations.  Worthy of a trip to try for yourself.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good service and good food.  Once the minor bugs of a new place are worked through, I hope it becomes great.  It took a little while to be seated, even though it was not busy.  The food was a little slow in coming, and well prepared.  The beer selection was okay, but not great.

data.title: East End Grill has Potential!
data.text: We tried East End Grill, in downtown Lafayette, for a recent family dinner.  The setting is quite nice....modern and appealing.  However, the noise level makes it almost impossible to carry on a conversation.  Acoustics need some work!  Everyone in our 5 member group agreed the food was quite average.  The meatball appetizer and French fries with truffle oil were not that special.  The three different steaks were ok, but there are several other local restaurants that serve better.  The one dish that proved to be outstanding was the shrimp and cheesy grits.  It was delicious!  Overall, this restaurant has potential.....just needs some more work refining some of the menu items.

data.title: Very nice, but noisy
data.text:
Title says it all. Very nice restaurant. Nice decor, industrial/modern style...attractive. Excellent food, excellent presentation. Entrée menu somewhat limited. Extensive wine and whiskey/bourbon menu.  The server was very charming and the staff in general was very welcoming

The only drawback, and it's somewhat significant, is the ecoustics. Although the dining room was not packed, the noise level was such that it made it difficult to hear the other members of our group at our table. . The wait staff mentioned that this was a common comment and that management was in the process of seeing what could be done about it. 

Would I go back?  I really liked the place, so yes, but probably just with one other person at a time.

data.title: Anniversary Celebration
data.text: We were a table of six on a week night. Got seated right away.   Each of us had a different selection and the food was excellent.  Service was good too.  One thing was interesting.  Someone ordered a bourbon and water.  When it came to the table it was a shot of burbon a glass of ice and a glass of water.  Shouldn't it be mixed by the bartender?  Overall a nice meal.  I will be back.  Nice new place for upper main street.

data.title: Great New Spot in Downtown Lafayette
data.text:
The buzz about this new spot has been good so I took a small group of alumni for dinner. We started with 2 appetizers - the crab cake (yummy) and meatballs (intriguing). I would recommend both. The majority of the group ordered the filet mignon in varying levels (MR to MW). The manager stopped by our table and immediately offered to recook a steak that was ordered medium and was on the more MW side. Exceptional food. Exceptional service. Highly recommended!

Oh...dessert was divine as well. We ordered the peach cobbler and flourless chocolate cake. You can't go wrong!

data.title: Outstanding Value
data.text:
This is a great restaurant. One of my favorite. The price is right and the quality of the food is outstanding making this a really good value. The service was outstanding.  And because it is quickly becoming a town favorite you have to go early otherwise you might have to wait a while
to get sitted. I highly recommmend it.

data.title: Nice outside area
data.text: We've been to the East End Grill before, but for the Mosey down Main Street we sat outside on the patio.  Nice night and there was also music.  The owner was in and out and very attentive to everyone and everything.  Our waitress Rachel was excellent.  Very chatty and attentive as well.  Once they get the inside acoustics worked out, we will be back inside I am sure,

data.title: New Favorite Place!
data.text: I had no idea this great restaurant was here!  We went on a Wednesday night and sat outside.  The staff was wonderful and very helpful with menu questions.  I ended up having the grilled salmon and it is BY FAR the best grilled salmon I have ever had!  I can't wait to go back and have it again!

data.title: A new gem!
data.text:
We happened to drive past on our way to another restaurant, and were caught by the outdoor seating surrounded by attractive wrought iron on a brand new brick and cement apron. This end of Main Street has just been classed up to a Destination.

East End is a rustic yet sophisticated urban restaurant. On a Tuesday evening the place was crowded, which tells you something about the fare. The well-lit bar was the sort that decent people go to to engage in lively conversation, rather than to brood. As a vegan, I had the bean soup and a Caesar salad, while hubby had the salmon. Both were attractively presented and perfectly done. Our waitress was cheerful, available, and quick. Afterwards we had the best dessert in a restaurant I've had in a year! The flourless chocolate cake with ganache was absolute perfection-- not overpoweringly sweet, but balances and restrained yet full bodied. Yes, I am a dessert snob!

The owner came around and introduced himself, which was very cool. I thanked him for the healthy vegan options, and he said more would be introduced in the future.

I think we just found a new favorite restaurant.

data.title: Loud , missed my value point.
data.text: I eat often enough downtown.  For lunch I expect value. My sandwich was good but pretty small, side salad was pretty small too. I don't like being pushed drinks on a Wednesday at noon. It was airport runway load, my friend and I couldn't Cary a conversation. Owner came over for a shouting conversation too.  I like a $10 price point for lunch, BrewCo has daily specials that fit that bill, and I can talk easily.  I'll try it again but the sound level is deafening.

data.title: Would visit again!
data.text: A relatively new place in downtown Lafayette.  So we took a chance and we were pleasantly surprised.  Good food and good service.  Nice atmosphere as well.  The only down side was the acoustics.  It is so noisy in there that you can hardly hear the waiter or waitress.  Especially for those of us who are older or hard of hearing to begin with.  The owner came around and introduced himself and told us that he is working with an engineer to get some sound deadening installed.  Thank you!
